stem:
A patient complained of itchy, red eyes. No history of mucopurulent discharge. No history of trauma. He works on a construction site. He also complained of an on and off runny nose.

Which of the following will you choose to relieve eye symptoms?
disc:
Signs and symptoms of allergic conjunctivitis include itching, redness, watery discharge, and a burning sensation. Many patients have concomitant allergic rhinitis.

Topical therapies include vasoconstrictor-antihistamine combinations (e.g. naphazoline and pheniramine), anti-histamines with mast cell stabilization properties (olopatadine and alcaftadine), NSAIDs (limited evidence), and short courses of steroids.
